Posts.Title: hoping but afraid duckie4720 sunrays123

Posts.Content: duckie4720 wrote: My mom was just admitted to the hospital for gallstones and they found a lump in her breast.  It's unilateral and painless, and they say she has some axillary lymph nodes.  She also presented with ascites, which sparked the entire workup.  I'm just scared and holding out hope that the ascites is due to something else and not any kind of abdominal mets.  She had an US guided needle biopsy today and they want to get a PET tomorrow.  It kind of irritates me that they're doing a PET before getting the biopsy results back, I mean, are they so sure it's cancer that they're looking for mets before they even get the damn results??  I'm just so stressed out and worried for her. Posts.Title: hoping but afraid duckie4720 sunrays123

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 07:43PM duckie4720 wrote: Thanks for all of your kind words.  The PET was negative thank God, but they did conclude from it that she has 2 areas of cancer in her breast.  We haven't got the biopsy back yet so I don't know the stage but I'm just SO thankful that there were no mets.  The doc said she'd most likely need a mastectomy and that we'd test for hormone receptors and all.  Do you know if it's just hormone therapy that they'll do or if they will want to try chemo too pre-op?  The largest lump is about 2 cm... Best of luck to you as well in this scary time, sunrays.
Posts.Title: hoping but afraid duckie4720 sunrays123

Posts.Content: duckie4720 wrote: Waiting on my mom's test results.  They say that the mass is fixed and hard, and that she has some enlarged lymph nodes on the affected side.  I know what that means.    They want to get a PET scan and I'm terrified that they'll find mets.  They just biopsied the primary today so we'll find out tomorrow what exactly we're dealing with I guess.  I'm just so afraid for her because she doesn't want to go through chemo/radiation and all.  Log in to post a reply
